problem.markdown:
A high-quality MOOC probably costs about $500,000 to create. This can be much higher with heavy investment in production-values (e.g. professionally-produced video), which translate into higher perception of quality, but not more learning. All of the content in this course was filmed with a cell phone camera, a $5 microphone (but correctly used), and edited with consumer-grade tools. It can be a bit lower without custom technology development (which would generally reduce learning). Given that, how much runway would we need for:
>> A Master's program consisting of eight courses? << (x) $4 million ( ) $10 million ( ) $16 million ( ) $1 billion ( ) $5 billion
>> A Master's program consisting of twenty courses, where the student picks eight? << ( ) $4 million (x) $10 million ( ) $16 million ( ) $1 billion ( ) $5 billion
>> A minimal B.S. program consisting of thirty two courses? << ( ) $4 million ( ) $10 million (x) $16 million ( ) $1 billion ( ) $5 billion
>> A complete undergraduate experience consisting of 2000 courses (as many as MIT)? << ( ) $4 million ( ) $10 million ( ) $16 million (x) $1 billion ( ) $5 billion
>> A complete undergraduate experience consisting of 10,000 courses (MIT+law+medicine+education+nursing+agriculture+...)? << ( ) $4 million ( ) $10 million ( ) $16 million ( ) $1 billion (x) $5 billion
problem.p: A high-quality MOOC probably costs about $500,000 to create. This can be much higher with heavy investment in production-values (e.g. professionally-produced video), which translate into higher perception of quality, but not more learning. All of the content in this course was filmed with a cell phone camera, a $5 microphone (but correctly used), and edited with consumer-grade tools. It can be a bit lower without custom technology development (which would generally reduce learning). Given that, how much runway would we need for:
A Master's program consisting of eight courses?
